title: The Randwick Connection: How Eddie Jones and Michael Cheika owe debt to a rugby mentor who made them both cry
text:
There is nothing that Eddie Jones or Michael Cheika can say or do in the build-up to Saturday’s World Cup quarter-final that will break ‘the umbilical cord’ forged in their time together at Randwick rugby club three decades ago.

It is remarkable that one east Sydney club should produce two such eminent coaches as well two such distinctive personalities: ambitious, bolshie, acerbic, confrontational yet also imbued with a love of the sport that transcends any personal animus.

The pair are outsiders, naturally wary, invariably spiky. Jones has Japanese heritage, while Cheika is the son of Lebanese immigrants and imbued with sufficient self-confidence and drive that he was able to make a fortune...
description: There is nothing that Eddie Jones or Michael Cheika can say or do in the build-up to Saturday’s World Cup quarter-final that will break ‘the umbilical cord’ forged in their time together at Randwick rugby club three decades ago.
